In Julia, Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

In Julia, you can achieve this by using the built-in `replace` function in combination with the `\W` regex pattern which matches any non-alphanumeric character (spaces, dashes etc.). 

Here's a simple implementation of your request:

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    return replace(lowercase(strip(col)), r"\W", "_")
end
```

You can use this function like so:

```julia
column = " My Column "
print(clean_column(column))  # Outputs: my_column
```
